result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Dietz

defendant.name: Dietz, Christopher J
defendant.address: 417 Washington Ave # A, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc

Defendant received copy of information. (Will be filed with same charges)
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

2:28 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz appeared by video, in custody. . Attorney Anne Renc in court for Christopher J Dietz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/10/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3

To Cover all Cases:
22GF414, 22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 and 21CF482.
Not be on the premises of Festival Foods
Comply with all open bond conditions

1:11 PM Defendant Christopher James Dietz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Return on Warrant in:  22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 & 21CF482.

BY THE COURT: 
All Warrants quashed on  22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 & 21CF482.

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Theft - Intentionally Take, Felony Bail Jumping & Misdemeanor Bail Jumping.  
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Anne Renc currently represents the defendant on other cases.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Court sets a $1,500 cash bond to cover all cases listed above with conditions as stated on the record.

Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
